tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE book_lending_history (
  lending_id INT,
  book_id INT,
  member_id INT,
  lending_date DATE,
  due_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE BookLendingHistory (
  book_id INT NOT NULL,
  user_id INT NOT NULL,
  checkout_date DATE NOT NULL,
  due_date DATE NOT NULL,
  return_date DATE
);
CREATE TABLE books (id INT PRIMARY KEY, title VARCHAR(255), author VARCHAR(255), genre VARCHAR(100), publish_date DATE);
CREATE TABLE members (id INT PRIMARY KEY, name VARCHAR(255), email VARCHAR(255), phone_number VARCHAR(20), address VARCHAR(255));
CREATE TABLE book_lending (id INT PRIMARY KEY, book_id INT REFERENCES books(id), member_id INT REFERENCES members(id), lending_date DATE, return_date DATE);
CREATE TABLE overdue_books (id INT PRIMARY KEY, book_id INT REFERENCES books(id), member_id INT REFERENCES members(id), days_overdue INT);

CREATE TABLE books (
  book_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  title VARCHAR(255),
  author VARCHAR(255),
  publish_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE members (
  member_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  first_name VARCHAR(50),
  last_name VARCHAR(50),
  address VARCHAR(255)
)

CREATE TABLE lending_records (
  record_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  book_id INT,
  member_id INT,
  lend_date DATE,
  due_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE categories (
  category_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  category_name VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE payments (
  payment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  record_id INT,
  amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
  payment_date DATE
)
